roleset.name: to make dim or indistinct, to conceal
roleset.note: OBSCURE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'obscure' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from obscure.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: obscure-v: all arguments
example.text: But the government now claims that [a group of company managers and lawyers]-1 engaged in an elaborate strategy [*ICH*-1] over five years [*]-1 to obscure from federal authoritiesthe extent and details of `` widespread '' fraudulent billing practices .
example.arg: the extent and details of `` widespread '' fraudulent billing practices

example.name: obscure-v: transitive
example.text: The U.S. Coast Guard closed six miles of the Houston Ship Channel , where about 150 companies have operations [*T*-1], because the thick , black smoke obscured the area .

roleset.name: be indistinct, concealed, dimmed
roleset.note: OBSCURE-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from obscure.01-j)

example.name: obscure-j
example.text: Sometimes his meaning is obscure from excess of condensation, or from incompleteness of expression.
example.arg: from excess of condensation, or from incompleteness of expression
